mods.note: 3319/15^34} British Eabessy, Bagdad, 28th May, 1936, Dear Department, Your letter Ko. E 259/159/34 of February 84th in which toe Admiralty ask whether the Ironian Government havt delinitely decided to erect a light on Kale Island. Colonel Ward tells ue that he understands from a confidential source that an order both for this light and Messrs. Br.rbier, Benerd and 'furenne of Paris. He cannot state whet specifications were submitted by this firm. An unsuccessful tender however quoted For Ha is ; revolving light with Dalen light and 27,000 H.O. P. or alternatively electric light and 100,000 H.C.P. for Bushire i Oscillating beacon with light power of 2,000,000 H. 0.P. This was specified to be a combined light for marine and aerial purposes. Yours &c., CHA! GERY. 3 Department, ^eign Office.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

mods.abstract: A map of the Eastern Persian Gulf that was compiled by Commander C G Constable and Lieutenant Arthur William Stiffe in 1860. Corrections made by Commander Frederic H Walter, HMS Odin and Lieutenant H T Bowen, HMS Alert in 1910. This version was printed by the Admiralty in 1934. Engraved by J & C Walker.The maps has major settlements and relief marked, with water depth shown by soundings. An area of a proposed Royal Navy survey is marked in pink on the map.The map has detailed inserts showing the shore lines of Charak, Kais, Ras al-Khaimah, Hor [Khor] Fakkan, Abu Dhabi and Chiru.
